intro: Laserpitium obliquum, commonly known as the bent-leaved hawk's-beard, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Asteraceae. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of the Himalayas. The plant features slender, branching stems and lance-shaped leaves that are often slightly curled or bent. Its flowers are yellow and arranged in a composite head, typical of the daisy family. It is often found in rocky or alpine environments, where it thrives in well-drained soil and full sun.
